origin: Middle English patron 'something serving as a model', from Old French (see patron).

usage.stamt: Structurally, the tumor cells were arranged in a medullary pattern composed of polygonal tumor cells.
The hair-cells within the spiralling cochlear duct are arranged in a pattern like the bristles of a brush.
The fossils indicate the wings had feathers, arranged in a similar pattern to that of modern birds..

synonyms.words: model, example, criterion, standard, basis, point of reference
